attributes.action: Get the government to subsidise motorway services for the English HGV drivers.
attributes.additional_details: I am HGV driver delivering to the main retailers of the country. As we the drivers are working long hours making sure the outlets are full when we need a break it varries on how much it is to stay in the service areas around the county. Some are exspensive I want the government to subsidise these service ares make them all one charge.
attributes.background: Subsidising the motorway services so they are all one price for the English truckers.

rejection.details:
It’s about something that the UK Government or Parliament is not responsible for.


This is the responsibility of retailers at service stations, not the Government or Parliament. 

You could start a new petition asking Parliament to change the law, to require employers of HGV drivers to pay allowances for food and drink consumed during legally-required rest stops.
